SECRET.
BATTLE SITUATION - EVENING - 7th SEPTEMBER, 1918.
1. WESTERN FRONT.
(a) British Front. On the SOMME front we have advanced to the line BEAUVOIS, (inclusive), 1,000 yards east of TRETOON, POEUILLY, BERNES, (all inclusive), ROISEL, (doubtful), VILLIERS-FAUCON, GUYENCOURT, (both inclusive), HEUDICOURT, (doubtful). East of POEUILLY we are pushing on towards VERMAND.
There is nothing to report from the rest of the British front.
(b) French Front. North of the OISE the French have taken TERGUIER and have advanced to CUGNY, OLLEZY and DURY.
South of the CISE they have penetrated the HINDENBURG LINE at BARISIS and BASSOLES.
South of the AILETTE they have taken LAFFAUX.
2. ITALIAN AND MECEDONIAN FRONTS.
There is nothing to report.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
7th September, 1918.
Issued at 6.45 p.m.
